data.title: What is the capital of Burkina Faso – arab travelers
data.text:
Burkina Faso

Burkina Faso, or in English Burkina Faso It is an African country, and it is located in relation to the continent of Africa in the western side. Burkina is completely surrounded by land, with no water body bordering it. Burkina Faso is surrounded by a group of countries, and its number reaches six countries. These countries are: Niger, Benin, Togo, Ghana, Ivory Coast and Mali, while Niger borders them from the eastern side. As for Benin, it borders it from the far southeast. As for the southern side, it is bordered by Togo and Ghana. As for the state of Ivory Coast, it borders it from the southwestern side. As for Mali, it borders it to the north and the west.

The capital of Burkina Faso

The capital of Bukina Faso is the city of Ouagadougou, and it is called in English Ouagadougou, and the name of this city is usually abbreviated as follows: Ouaga, where only the first part of the long name is given. The city of Ouagadougou is the central capital of Burkina Faso; it is the political, economic, commercial and industrial capital of Burkina Faso, and it is the most important city in it, in which a large population is concentrated, as it is the largest city in Burkina Faso in terms of population, in terms of population density, and in it An international airport. The climate in Ouagadougou is similar to that prevailing in the center of the African continent. It is a hot tropical or tropical climate.

Burkina Faso website

The city of Ouagadougou is located in the center of Burkina Faso, and belongs to the province of Keddyago, or in English: Kadiogo, and this province is one of the 45 provinces that make up Burkina Faso, and these provinces are divided into a group of administrative regions, and there are 13 provinces and a province Kediago belongs to the central region, and the city of Ouagadougou is located in relation to this province in the center, and the city of Ouagadougou is not only the capital of the state, but is the capital of both the central region and the province of Kadiaago.

The area of ​​Burkina Faso

Ouagadougou extends over an area of ​​219.3 square kilometers, or 84.7 square miles. The average height above the sea level is 305 meters. The city of Ouagadougou is the largest city in Bukina Faso in terms of population, with a population exceeding 1.5 million, its population in particular, according to estimates by the year 2012: 1,626,950 people, and this number constitutes approximately 9.4% of the total population of Bukina Faso, which It is 17,322,796 people, according to 2010 estimates. With regard to the population density in the city of Ouagadougou, it is the largest city in Bukina Faso in terms of population density, with a population density of approximately: 7419 people per square kilometer.
